column2: Paper is a fast NoSQL-like storage for Java/Kotlin objects on Android with automatic schema migration support.

column5:
Swap compile instruction with implementation 

compile is now (at least, as of April 2018) obsolete. See https://github.com/pilgr/Paper/issues/127#issuecomment-450790889

Update README.md

Added clarification for "Handle data structure changes" section

Add test to make sure subfolders for custom book location created
recursively
Add test using app's cache folder to save Book's content
New API: `Paper.bookOn()` to set storage location for book instances
Update Kotlin to 1.1.50, used for tests only

New API to get folder path for book or file path for key

Fix #53

Add threading section to README

Fix #50

Fix typo in public API

Add new Book.exists() API
Mark old Book.exist() as deprecated.

Merge pull request #94 from pilgr/hiperioncn-lock_by_per_key

Speed up concurrent read/writes for different keys

Fix issue #65.
Add KeyLocker and unit test.

Merge pull request #91 from pilgr/development

Merge v2.5

Don't consider db file broken on failed read and don't delete it

Fix #90
Fix crash and data corruption during 1.5 => 2.0 transition

Merge pull request #88 from martinbonnin/add-1.5-to-2.1-upgrade-test

added a test case for the 1.5 => 2.1 transition
added a test case for the 1.5 => 2.1 transition

Update README.md

I strongly recommend updating Paper to version 2.1 to avoid data corruption on Android N+!

Force update Objenesis version from 2.2->2.3 to fix warning on
instantiating classes on Android N+
Add javadocs for Paper.setLogLevel() and Book.setLogLevel APIs

Merge pull request #41 from aaronpoweruser/master

Fixes #40: Allow logging kryo marshalling
Add note that only seconds granularity is guaranteed for `book.lastModified` API
Fix `book.lastModified` tests as many file systems only support seconds granularity for file's last-modification time

Merge pull request #68 from fiskurgit/timestamp

add lastModified for given key to return timestamp of last update
Add backward compatibility for data saved in Kryo 3.x format.
Error message about no-arg constructor classes is not required anymore

Merge pull request #57 from pakoito/development

Remove dependency on protocol buffers and update envirnoment
Update android build tools to 24 on app
Update kryo-serializers and kryo to 4.0.0, kotlin to 1.0.4, and android build tools to 24.
Update android build tools and maven plugin

Merge pull request #51 from arok/development

Fixed #28. Removed allowBackup tag from AndroidManifest file

Merge pull request #37 from pilgr/development

Version 1.5
Increase memory requirements for travis builds
Revert back sdkVersion to 21 as Travis doesnt support api 23
Add support for classes with constructors having arguments.

Merge pull request #31 from wellguimaraes/development

Added UUID serializer and the possibility to add custom serializers
Added UUID serializer and the possibility to add custom serializers

Merge pull request #24 from pilgr/development

Release version 1.1

Merge pull request #22 from serveravt/master

getAllKeys() added

Improve exception message if no-arg constructor is missing

Show detailed how-to fix message when deserialized class has no
public no-arg constructor.
Add old Paper api back and mark it as deprecated.
Disable unsafe possibility to write null values
Run tests on emulator with api 15 - lowest api available on Travis

Fix Book creation in multi thread mode
IAdd more multi-book tests

Merge pull request #9 from Evisceration/min-sdk-8

Decrease minimum sdk requirements to API 8

Merge pull request #10 from libraua/factory-refactoring

New multi-book API
Refactoring. From Singleton to Static Factory

gradle: set minimum sdk to 8

  * There is no need to set the minimum sdk version to 15.
    Allow to use it on older apis as well

  * Hawk depends on API 8, so set the minimum sdk to 8 as well.
    Paper will build with an even lower sdk as well, just the tests
    will fail to build and API 8 is a reasonable number as it covers
    99% of the target audience.

Change-Id: I0365859041743ce078af4f02c29c86c55a64b403
Signed-off-by: Alexander Martinz <eviscerationls@gmail.com>

Merge pull request #8 from Evisceration/update-dependencies

gradle: update kryo and kyro-serializers

gradle: update kyro and kyro-serializers

  * kyro 3.0.2:
    https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/kryo/blob/master/CHANGES.md#301---302-2015-06-17

  * kyro-serializers 0.33:
    https://github.com/magro/kryo-serializers/commits/080cd8053de441b8c8a1dc94c321854c1ff915ee

Change-Id: Ic87f09a64bdb71462c667422738118975e584397
Signed-off-by: Alexander Martinz <eviscerationls@gmail.com>
Use api 21 because Travis doesn't support api 22+

Merge pull request #1 from libraua/master

Added tests for valid and invalid keys for Paper
Added tests for valid and invalid keys for Paper

Additional compatibility tests

Check that exception is thrown on read class with changed field type.
Check that transition fields are ignored on save.

Add serializers for non standard collections.

Add serializers from de.javakaffee:kryo-serializers project for:
- Unmodifiable collections
- Synchronized collections
- Arrays$ArrayList

Use custom serializer returning ArrayList instances for:
- AbstractList$SubAbstractListRandomAccess
- AbstractList$SubAbstractList

Make possible to use Paper after drop all data by clear()

The new dir to keep Paper files will be created automatically on next write
attempt even if all data has been cleared by calling Paper.clear(). So init()
is not required after clear().

Rename Paper.destroy() to Paper.clear()

Clear() uses existed Paper instance if available, otherwise new temporary
instance is created.

Support for forward and backward compatibility.

Fields can be added or removed.
Changing the type of a field is not supported except very limited cases like int->long
Migrate to new simpler API with generic put/get methods

Initialize storage on first access.

Clean up storage implementation structure.
Add put/get Map api and corresponding tests
Put a note that lib is under development.
Convert tests to Junit4 and use AssertJ

Make possible to save any type of data.

Create separate API to put/get Lists and Sets

Simplify Paper api

Make possible to read/write data using static helper methods.
Use only one Paper instance.
Rename PaperDb to simple Paper.

Use VersionFieldSerializer by default

Modify tests to use private fields in saved Person class

Revert "Initial commit"

This reverts commit d5bbd34aa038e026d5268aa9db5bf6969e2a6aa4.
